identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of AR-14034 in Participants With Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration (nAMD)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 1/2 Two-Stage Dose Escalation and Randomized Parallel-Group Study to Evaluate the Safety, Preliminary Treatment Effects, and Durability of AR-14034 Sustained Release Implant Compared to Intravitreal Anti-Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Treatment in Participants With Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and durability of single- and repeat administration of AR-14034 Sustained Release (SR) in subjects with neovascular age-related macular degeneration (nAMD).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This study will be conducted in two stages. Stage 1 is a 48-week, dose-escalation, open-label evaluation of AR-14034 SR. Two cohorts will be enrolled, for an approximate total of 10 subjects. Subjects in both cohorts will attend visits through Week 48 for assessment of safety and preliminary treatment effects.

Stage 2 is a 56-week (plus extension) double-masked, active comparator, randomized, parallel group evaluation of AR-14034 SR compared with aflibercept. Approximately 130 subjects will be enrolled and randomized 2:2:1 to AR-14034 SR lower dose, AR-14034 SR higher dose, or aflibercept dosed as labelled. Subjects will attend visits through Week 56 for assessment of safety and treatment effects. A 16-week open label extension phase will be conducted thereafter.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Stage 1 will enroll 2 cohorts. Stage 2 will enroll 3 treatment arms.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Stage 1 is open label. Stage 2 is double-masked.

armGroups.label: Cohort 1 (Stage 1)
armGroups.description: One intravitreal (IVT) injection of aflibercept 2 mg at Week -1 and one IVT insertion of AR-14034 SR lower dose at Baseline. Up to one retreatment with AR-14034 SR will be administered between Weeks 4 and 36 according to protocol-specified disease activity criteria.
interventionNames: Drug: AR-14034 SR implant lower dose

armGroups.label: Cohort 2 (Stage 1)
armGroups.description: One IVT injection of aflibercept 2 mg at Week -1 and one IVT insertion of AR-14034 SR higher dose at Baseline. Up to one retreatment with AR-14034 SR will be administered between Weeks 4 and 36 according to protocol-specified disease activity criteria.
interventionNames: Drug: AR-14034 SR implant higher dose

armGroups.label: AR-14034 SR lower dose (Stage 2)
armGroups.description: One IVT injection of aflibercept 2 mg at Baseline, Week 4, and Week 8, with one IVT insertion of AR-14034 SR lower dose at Week 6. Up to one retreatment of AR-14034 SR will be administered between Weeks 16 and 52 according to protocol-specified disease activity criteria. Sham procedures will be performed between Weeks 16 and 52 except when AR-14034 SR repeat treatment is administered.
interventionNames: Drug: AR-14034 SR implant lower dose

armGroups.label: AR-14034 SR higher dose (Stage 2)
armGroups.description: One IVT injection of aflibercept 2 mg at Baseline, Week 4, and Week 8, with one IVT insertion of AR-14034 SR higher dose at Week 6. Up to one retreatment of AR-14034 SR will be administered between Weeks 16 and 52 according to protocol-specified disease activity criteria. Sham procedures will be performed between Weeks 16 and 52 except when AR-14034 SR repeat treatment is administered.
interventionNames: Drug: AR-14034 SR implant higher dose

armGroups.label: Aflibercept (Stage 2)
armGroups.description: One IVT injection of aflibercept 2 mg at Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24, Week 32, Week 40, and Week 48. Sham procedures will be performed between Weeks 16 and 52.

interventions.name: AR-14034 SR implant lower dose
interventions.description: AR-14034 SR administered as an intravitreal implant

interventions.name: Aflibercept Injection
interventions.description: Aflibercept administered as a 2 milligram (mg) intravitreal injection

interventions.name: Sham procedure
interventions.description: Needleless syringe used to simulate an intravitreal injection

interventions.name: AR-14034 SR implant higher dose
interventions.description: AR-14034 SR administered as an intravitreal implant

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in ETDRS BCVA at the average across two visits, Weeks 44 and 48 (Stage 2)
primaryOutcomes.description: Visual acuity will be measured after manifest refraction using Early Treatment of Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) letter charts in a 4-meter lane under standard illumination. Best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) will be recorded as the number of letters read correctly. The difference between the average across Weeks 44 and 48, and the baseline visit will be reported. One eye (study eye) will contribute to the analysis.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in ETDRS BCVA by visit (Stage 2)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Visual acuity will be measured after manifest refraction using ETDRS letter charts in a 4-meter lane under standard illumination. BCVA will be recorded as the number of letters read correctly. The difference between a given post-baseline visit and the baseline visit will be reported. One eye (study eye) will contribute to the analysis.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in Central Subfield Thickness (CST) by visit (Stage 2)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Central subfield thickness (CST) will be assessed using spectral domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT) imaging and measured in micrometers. The difference between a given post-baseline visit and the baseline visit will be reported. One eye (study eye) will contribute to the analysis.

locations.facility: Northern California Retina Vitreous Associates Medical Group
